intro: Inezia integrifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf inezia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and entire. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun conditions. Inezia integrifolia is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and some toxic plants.
